New Records: Caden Dana became the youngest pitcher in Angels history to win his major league debut at 20 years, 259 days old.
Key Match Events: Caden Dana allowed two runs and two hits in six innings in his debut.
Taylor Ward extended his hitting streak to 12 games with a leadoff homer.
Anthony Rendon provided the go-ahead hit with a two-run single in the fifth.
Ben Joyce worked a scoreless ninth for his fourth save.
Post-Match Reflections: Caden Dana expressed that getting a win in his debut was a good feeling.
Angels manager Ron Washington praised Dana's poise and ability to pitch in the big leagues.
Seattle manager Dan Wilson commented on Dana's secondary pitches complementing his fastball.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Dana led Double-A with 147 strikeouts and appeared in the MLB Futures Game in July.
Dana was an 11th-round pick in the 2022 amateur draft and went 9-7 with a 2.52 ERA in 23 starts for Rocket City before being called up.
